instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no any sign of life
threads.message: hello to all is my first repair on a mac book and i would like if anyone can help me i have one <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> the fan spinning when i press the button but i dont have any sign of life i am thinking that is the backlight but i would be sure before to order it i dont know what first i have to test so i can figure out where is the problem

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no any sign of life
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Caps Lock light reacts?
If yes, then is only video problem.

Check with Apple if the machine is covered by screen replacment program.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no any sign of life
threads.message: no i dont have any lights on backlight

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no any sign of life
threads.message:
I didn't ask about backlight.
The Caps Lock button light reacts when you press it???
Do you have USB activity?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no any sign of life
threads.message: No is not reacts when i press but the fan spin when i press power button i have the schematics and boardview i can test any voltage if is help

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no any sign of life
threads.message:
Your problem is not video related, as the machine has no activity; apart of fan spin.
Lucky to have schematic.
We don't even know which board model is; keep the secret for you.

You should try DFU mode and see if machine is recognized at least.
